main event: A civilian observed a blue luminous object descending slowly in the sky over Middleboro, Massachusetts.
interesting points: The object had a blue luminous color and was descending at a slow rate of speed.
The description is consistent with that of a meteor.
Surface winds were 313 degrees at 2 knots and 270 degrees at 28 knots at 10,090 feet.
A representative of the Smithsonian Astrophysical Observatory suggested the object was probably a small meteor, but there was a lack of conclusive evidence to make a definite identification.
The report was filed as part of Project Blue Book, the U.S. Air Force's investigation of unidentified flying objects.
